measured_by: 11-point self-report confidence scale (bars numbered 0–10, labelled 'Guessing' to '100 % sure')
justification: The Methods section states that after making a choice, “the choice movement activated a 11-point confidence scale … Each bar was labeled with the respective rating (0 to 10)… the first and last bar … were labeled with 'Guessing' and '100% sure',” indicating that subjective confidence was captured with this explicit 11-point scale.

measured_by: continuous subjective value rating scale (horizontal bar with colour gradient and scratch-card icons)
justification: The article explains that “Before and after phase 2, a rating scale appeared in which participants rated the subjective value of each CS on a continuous scale. The extremes of the scales were labeled with a scratch card of only blanks (lower end) and only 1-Euro coins (upper end),” showing that subjective value was assessed with this continuous visual analogue scale.

measured_by: proportion of identical choices across repeated presentations of the same CS pair
justification: In the Results the authors note that “choice consistency increased in the course of phase 2, indicated by a positive effect of CS pair repetition number,” and Figure 3A compares consistency between first, second and third occurrences, demonstrating that the construct was quantified by calculating how often participants repeated the same choice for the same stimulus pair.
